column1: length around off, right on the money, moves across and defends it towards square leg
length around off, a bit of shape away, half a step forward and defended on the leg side
a bit of confusion. A touch fuller from Lakmal this time, just around the off stump, pushes it towards the left of mid-on, and sets off, Elgar looks back at the fielder and says no just in time
length outside off, moving away after landing, left alone
short of length outside off, stays back and defends, the ball hits the outer half and rolls towards covers
length, fifth stump line, gets behind the line and defends right under his eyes this time
length around off, a little bit of extra bounce as Elgar comes forward and defends
fuller around off, pushes it towards covers
fuller, wide outside off, Elgar pushes at it and misses, an appeal for caught-behind but the noise was of the bat hitting the turf

but this time there is no doubt. Length ball, bowled closer to the stumps, holds its line. Elgar looks to defend but ends up playing inside the line of the ball, a faint edge and a regulation catch for Dickwella
length outside off, goes away with the angle, left alone. Not much bounce or carry on that occasion

a huge appeal for lbw, but Aleem Dar is unmoved. A bit of discussion if Sri Lanka want to review, yes, signals Dimuth. But looks like he was a bit too late. It was a length ball around leg, Amla comes forward and looks to defend, misses and is rapped dead-front, replays show it would have been out had Sri Lanka acted fast
length ball, pushes it towards short midwicket
length around off, defended from the back foot
beaten! A touch fuller outside off, Markram goes for a drive but it not to the pitch of the ball, pushes at it and gets beaten
back of length outside off, punched towards covers for a quick single and South Africa are off the mark
length outside off, in the corridor, left alone. Dickwella collects it near head height
back of length around off, Amla gets on his toes and defends
length outside off, some room there, Markram goes for the cuts, but fails to keep it down, lands just short of the point fielder
fuller on the stumps, looks to flick it one the leg side, a bit of leading edge down the ground
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards deep square leg for three, he too is off the mark
fuller down the leg side, swinging further down
length around middle and leg, stays behind and defends on the leg side
once again pitched up on the pads, a hint of inswing, clipped towards fine leg
length outside off, moving the ball away from the batsman, left alone
length around off, going other way this time, taps it towards short midwicket
length, fifth stump line and leaving the batsman, comes forward and shoulders arms
length outside off, stays beside the line and blocks
short of length on middle and leg, flicked towards fine leg
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-off
short of length, goes for the punch but too close for that, chops towards point
length outside off, angling further away, goes for the cut but cannot connect
length ball on the pads, goes for the flick but misses as the ball keeps low, a leg-bye to fine leg
back of length on the stumps, a bit of hint back, Markram gets behind the line and blocks
a touch fuller this time, Markram standing at off stump, takes half a step forward and blocks

that's a superb catch at second slip. Amla hasn't moved, Sri Lanka are celebrating but the umpires converge to discuss if it carried. The soft signal from umpire Kettleborough is not out. Coming back to the delivery, this is short of length that nips away from outside off, got it to lift off the deck, Amla was looking to play initially but then changed his mind and tried to withdraw his bat at the end, but it was too late. It took the edge and it was superbly grabbed at second slip. It was such a clean catch that Michael Holding on air said 'I'm walking back to the Caribbean if that's given not out. . Fortunately, sanity prevails, there's conclusive evidence to overturn the decision and Amla is walking back.
slants this back into middle and leg on a length, nicely tucked off the pads past square leg for a couple
gets on top of the bounce and defends this with soft hands.
gets this to lift off the deck from outside off, left alone
this one goes to him on the bounce. Short of length and angling in, Bavuma tucks this gently to leg gully.
back of length outside off, good carry to the keeper as Bavuma leaves
mistimes this off-drive but manages to beat mid-off nonetheless
nice and full delivery angling away, just around the off-stump channel, left alone
stands tall and punches this beautifully through extra cover. That's too short, and it sat up nicely for a batsman of Markram's class.

this is a corker of a delivery! Would've troubled any top order batsman. It's full, gets this to bend back in really late, Markram plays all around it, misses and this beats the inside edge to hit the pad and sneak through the gap to crash into the stumps. Wow, this is absolutely magnificent. The kind of delivery that will give a bowler oodles of confidence. South Africa are on the mat.
gets this to skid through on a length on middle and leg, defended with soft hands to the leg side
tucks this with the angle towards fine leg. They'll come back for the second.
length on off stump, defended from the crease.
full and angling in from wide of the crease, Bavuma prods outside the line to get a thick inside edge towards square leg
gets this to nip away from outside off but the length is on the shorter side, left alone
once again goes short of length, hint of movement from around the fourth stump, Bavuma defends
full and moving away from outside off, he plays and misses
looks to jab at this delivery but pulls out at the last moment.
slants one full, but it's far too wide for Faf to have a poke at that
squared up by the length, squirts the thick outside edge to gully. Superb bowling, uncertain whether to go forward or back. Also not sure if Faf knows which way this is swinging.
angles one full on off, defended from the crease
full and angling across again, left alone
welcome runs. Pokes at the away-going delivery to get a thick outside edge between third slip and gully.
bunts this into the cover point region and scampers across for a quick single
full and angling in from wide of the crease, defended with soft hands.
full, nips away from outside off, left alone.
tucks this wide of square leg for an easy single
beautiful length, probes away outside off, he plays inside the line as this zips through to the keeper
late on the stroke as he goes back and across to block, no damage done as it rolls off the toe end to gully. Hurried onto him this time
gets a good stride forward and bunts this into the covers for a quick single.
slants a full delivery across the right-hander, left alone
edged but doesn't carry to second slip. Once again jabs with an angled bat
full on middle, shows the full face
movement in the air as he slants this full, squirted to gully
gentle push into the off side for a quick single
driven back but not timed all that well, just beats mid-off and they get a single
short of length, wide outside off, goes for the cut but doesn't middle it, toe-ends it into the ground
length outside off, sixth stump line, left alone
fell short of the first slip. Length outside off, around fourth stump, du Plessis hangs his bat, gets an outside edge but doesn't carry
fuller this time, in the corridor. Du Plessis goes for a big booming drive and misses
length outside off, swing in after going past the batsman, left alone by du Plessis
fuller outside off, and moving away from the batsman, left alone once again
length ball, just leaving the batsman, left alone
length around off, comes forward and drops it towards covers for a quick single
a surprise bouncer but du Plessis does well to bend down and let it sail over his head
short again, outside off this time, du Plessis was ready and pulls it in front of square for a couple
length but down the leg side, tickled away towards fine leg
length around off, comes forward and defends, a quick single as the ball rolls towards square leg
and gets that bounce straight away, length around off, nips back sharply, Bavuma was forward looking to defend but it keeps rising and hits the batsman near the armpit
but he follows it up with a leg-stump half-volley, flicked in front of square for a boundary
length outside off, comes forward and pushes at it, beaten
pitched up this time, wide outside off, Bavuma goes for the drive but the late away-movement takes a thick outside edge that falls short of third slip and races away towards the boundary
length around off and coming back in. Defended back towards the bowler
fuller outside off, comes forward and defends with an angled back towards point
length around off, and almost squaring up the batsman as the ball holds up on the wicket, a thick outside edge towards gully
back of length outside off, stands tall and punches it towards cover-point
length outside off, keeps coming in with the angle, left alone
short of length outside off, goes back and punches it past the gully fielder for four. Was in the air for some time but lands safely
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-on
fuller once again, a big stride forward and driven towards covers
length around off, stays back and defends down the wicket
fuller on the stumps, 137kph, pushed towards square leg
length outside off, once again good carry with Dickwella collecting it near his face, left alone though by the batsman
fuller on the pads and flicked away past square leg for four
fuller again but way down the leg side, was bowled at 143kph. A good take by the keeper, diving to his left
back of length outside off, defended on the off side
gentle length ball on off, defended
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone
prods outside the line as this rolls off a thick inside edge to fine leg
goes back into the crease and bunts this to the wide slip fielder on the bounce
nearly rolled back onto the stumps! Faf plays outside the line, this one jags back in a little, he plays with hard hands. Lots of oooohs and aaaahs at the moment
squared up by the length but manages to bunt it back to the bowler.
floats this full on middle, defended to short midwicket
length ball that moves away from outside off, left alone
driven into the gap between cover and point, Rajitha oversteps in his quest for extra pace.
right on top of the bounce as he defends
touch fuller, just outside off, left alone
invites the drive by pitching it up outside off, left alone.
helped along to the fine leg boundary. Too short and angling down, Bavuma controlled this very nicely
looks to cut but misses. This climbed on him, zipped through even though there was width
length on off, defended back
left alone again
touch short, moving away from the fifth stump or so, left alone
gets this to angle in full on the stumps, turned to midwicket
bunts this gently into the off side, wide of cover
beautiful bowling, he bowls this around a length on off, gets it to move away a little to draw him into a push and manages to beat the outside edge
imperiously driven into the gap between cover and mid-off. There was too much width, Faf planted forward and blasted this through the line
hurried into this back foot defence, hits the top part of Faf's bat. Immediately calls for a new bat.
length outside off, not much deviation off the deck, left alone
another delivery outside off that's left alone
loose drive, away from the body. Thick edge past gully. Streaky
lunges forward and stabs this into the off side
works this past mid-on, lovely wrist work. 'Nice net bowling at the moment, not much to put pressure on the batsmen' says Michael Holding on air.
flicked uppishly but into the gap at square leg. Huge gap there
width outside off, punched into the gap at sweeper cover. Runs coming far too easily at the moment
beaten on the drive, late movement does the trick this time
driven straight to short cover off a full delivery
touch full outside off, left alone
driven hard, but driven straight to mid-off
full and wide outside off, there for the drive but Bavuma is late on it
two men back for the hook but Bavuma bisects them with this pull shot. Superbly executed The intention was to always keep it down. Lovely
square driven! Too much width, he leant into it and crashed it away. Runs leaking big here
nice and full on the stumps, defended back
what a ball first up! Drifted in and spun away sharply to square him up and beat the edge by a whisker. Faf opened up, completely surprised by that. So close to a wicket first ball
touch short, he goes back and across to tuck it into the leg side
skips out and then lunges forward to defend this away. Lovely loop from the bowler.
steps out and lofts him over mid-on. Didn't get to the pitch but went through with the stroke
steps out to go over mid-off, gets a thick inside edge to mid-on however
paddled as he takes it on the full, fine leg comes around to cut that off
presses half-forward and bunts it into the of side

Has he tickled this down leg, there was a definite noise as this went past the bat. Umpire Kettleborough says no, and Sri Lanka have reviewed immediately.. Length ball slanting down, Faf late on this flick, but as it passes the batsman, the pad isn't anywhere near. Replays confirm a spike as ball passed the bat, so the decision will be overturned and Sri Lanka's lunch will taste much better than it would've otherwise. Terrific end to the session. Sri Lanka's morning all the way.
length around off, angling across de Kock, who pushes at it, gets a thick outside edge which races past the gully fielder
length, but down the leg side, flicked away fine for another four
length around off, comes forword and defends it with a vertical bat
length outside off, angling away from the batsman, left alone
length outside off, leaving away from the right-hander, left alone
fuller but further away from the batsman who is happy to leave it alone
pitched up around off, comes forward and drives it through covers, not much power behind it
short one this time, Bavuma was looking to withdraw his hands but fails to do so in time and the ball hits him on the gloves but dies in front of Dickwella
almost a yorker around off stump, de Kock does well to get his bat down in time, an inside edge towards fine leg
length outside off, comes forward and leaves it alone

that has carried to Dickwella, an appeal for caught-behind and Richard Kettleborough raises his finger after some thought. But de Kock has reviewed it immediately. Short of length outside off, de Kock moves towards the off side, before deciding to leave at the last moment, but replays show the ball hit the left arm on its way to the keeper. Also, it looked like the take from the keeper wasn't clean but all that doesn't matter
fuller around off, comes forward but was a bit late on the defence, gets an inside edge on to the pads
length around off, taps it towards the right of the cover fielder for a quick single
length in the corridor, comes forward before leaving it alone
length around off, stays beside the line and defends
length around off, comes forward but once again leaves it alone
a low full toss on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
length, in the corridor, a little bit away movement, shouldered arms by de Kock
length around off, comes forward and a gentle punch towards extra cover
fuller and angling in this time, de Kock pushes it at, the ball hits the inner part of the bat and goes towards fine leg
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover for one
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards mid-on
length outside off, in the corridor and left alone without any fuss
length but angling down the leg side, goes for the flick but cannot get to it, an optimistic appeal for caught-behind, not out
length outside off, pitching around fifth stump and moving away, left alone
short of length outside off, stays back and steers it past the gully fielder, moves to 46 with that boundary
fuller around off and smashes it away but ends up hitting straight to the extra cover fielder who fails to collect cleanly and concedes a run
back of length outside off, punches it towards deep point
back of length around off and middle, pushes it towards mid-on

is that a run-out at the bowler's end? It was fuller on the off stump, de Kock drives it back towards the bowler who gets his foot in line, and the deflection hits the stumps at the bowler's end. Bavuma was out of his crease but dives back promptly but was he quick enough? It's touch and go. Did he manage to get some part of his bat behind the line when the bails were dislodged, doesn't look like and the third umpire thinks that's out. An unfortunate manner to be dismissed
a bouncer around off stump, swivels to pull it down towards deep square leg
fuller around off, drives it towards covers to get off the mark with a single
length outside off, de Kock punches it past the point fielder for a couple
fuller around off, punched back towards the bowler who makes half a stop and the ball dribbles towards the stumps, although it goes past without disturbing them but Philander was in
looks to work this square, deflects wide of the keeper off the thigh pad
looks to flay this away-going delivery on the up through point but is beaten
gets a good stride forward and defends this length ball back down the pitch
slants a length ball across, punched to deep point
bowls full outside off to draw him into the drive, left alone
this is full on off, gets it to nip back in this time, defended back
driven firmly to mid-off
slashed away over point, down to the sweeper.
slants a length ball across, defended with soft hands into the gully
nice and full, much closer to the stumps, defended back with a straight bat
width on offer, slashed to deep point
dug in short, but this is down leg, left alone. Keeper collects on the bounce.
defends this full delivery back to Lakmal. Left a big gap between bat and pad, no alarming inward movement there so it was all good
touch full, around the fourth-stump, defended
works it off his hip to deep square leg
gets a good stride forward and bunts this length delivery to cover.
full and angling away, defended with his bat close to the pad
squirts this into the gap between point and gully
driven back hard, the bowler stops it with his boot
looks to cut but is cramped for room, looks to bunt it nevertheless but this one took off to just rap him on the glove. Winces in pain
mistimes the drive on the up to cover. Got it off the toe end
full and angling away, tempts the batsman to go for it, but De Kock leaves
eases this down to third man
lifter outside off, left alone
rocks back and pulls into the gap at deep square
goes back and across as he turns this into the leg side
reverse swept quite beautifully. What fear? Slow through the air, so there's no fizz and de Kock executes this superbly
lunges forward and turns this gently into the leg side
tucks this behind square as they jog the single
drawn forward by the flight, but he gets this to dip and spin away to beat the forward prod
slants a full delivery across, driven to cover
shortens his length but the line is down leg, de Kock looks to tickle fine but misses
cramped for room as he looks to punch behind point, rolls towards gully
driven firmly, just wide of cover and they scamper a single
gets well forward and defends to the off side
turns this full delivery on middle and leg to square leg.
length on middle and leg, turns it towards square leg
length around off, goes for a pull, inside edge on to the pads
length around off, stays back and defends
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length outside off, stays back and watches it go into the keeper's gloves
pitched up on the stumps, drives it gently towards mid-on
short of length, some room outside off, cuts it away towards deep point
length around off, comes forward and defends
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers

short of length outside off, was looking to shape up for a pull but it's too quick and also not that short. The ball hits the bat instead of the other way around and balloons straight up, Rajitha accepts a dolly. The umpires are checking if some part of his foot was behind the line and yes, there is that tiny part of the heel behind the bowling crease
length outside off, away from the batsman, left alone
length around middle and leg, pushed towards square leg for one
length outside off, comes forward before shouldering arms
short of length outside off, some room as well, Maharaj goes back and cuts it away for four
fuller outside off, Maharaj defends it on the back foot
tossed up around off and middle 76kph, comes forward and blocks
back of length outside off, punches it towards mid-off
flighted on the stumps, comes forward and defends
length around off, comes forward to defend, gets an inside edge on to the pads
length outside off, looks to drive it on the up, mistimes it down the ground
fuller around middle and leg, flicks it away towards fine leg
fuller around off, comes forward and defends
a sharp short delivery outside off, Maharaj does well to sway away and drop his hands down
length, sixth stump line, shouldered arms
and almost a replica of the last ball, length, way too outside off, left alone by Maharaj
fuller on the pads, clipped away towards square leg
short of length outside off, cuts it away past the cover fielder for another four in that region
length around middle and leg, some turn there but Maharaj is watchful and defends on the back foot
length around off, once again plays back to that, gets an inside edge through his legs towards fine leg
length outside off, not much room this time, Maharaj though goes for the cut again, gets a thick outside edge past the slip fielder
fuller around off, comes forward this time and pushes it towards extra cover
length around off, comes forward and smashes it between the stumps and the non-striker for four
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but misses
angling down the leg side, too far away for de Kock to get any bat on that, Dickwella dives across to make a stop
a high full toss around off and middle, worked away towards deep square leg
nippy, extra bounce from short of length, Maharaj takes his eyes off as he looks to defend, gets rapped on the gloves
short of length outside off, punches it towards extra cover
reverse sweeps this to cover.
struck on the pad as he tries the reverse sweep again, deflects off the pad towards backward point and they take a leg-bye
cut away wide of point for a quick single
nice flight, lands this on a length around middle and leg, tucked to deep square
too short, he makes room and cuts it into the gap between point and short third man, they take a couple
plays the short-arm jab over midwicket, towards the shorter side but Sri Lanka can't prevent the second
flayed on the up through extra cover, good work in the deep
length on middle and leg, worked nicely off his hip towards fine leg
squirts this to gully. Played all around it, this one straightened off a thick edge.
hustled for pace with this short of length delivery, somehow manages to nudge it towards square leg as he's pushed back into the crease
beaten as he's through with the pull even before the ball arrived
ripper of a bouncer, Maharaj is on the hop as he takes the bottom hand off the grip as this comes furiously at him, rolls off the glove to gully.
tossed up on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
rocks back and slaps this into the cover boundary, a very short one that side. Enough width, too short. Deserved to be punished.
gets well forward and defends back
it's the wrong'un which he cuts to deep point
he's heaved this into the stands at deep midwicket. Too much flight, he picked the length and went through one bounce. Super
eased with the spin to mid-off for a quick single
skids one across from wide of the crease, defended back
he's picked the bones out of this. Swivels around and pulls one bounce to the deep square leg fence
sways out of the way of this short ball angling away
squirts this full delivery into the covers. This tailed away late
full, just around off, defended.

this is a jaffa and he's got him! Maharaj reviews immediately, which means he believes he didn't nick it. Got this to angle in and leave him late to square him up, Maharaj pokes at the delivery and spontaneously looks back as this passes the bat. Dickwella grabs it and throws the ball up in celebration, Aleem Dar agreed. We'll need a few replays. Ultra-edge confirms a spike so Maharaj will have to get on his bike. What an inspired bowling change, Vishwa continues to impress.
slower ball, a full toss which slipped out of his hand perhaps, bunted into the off side.
angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, defended back
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends
whips this length ball on middle and leg to midwicket
dug in short, Rabada looks away and avoids this without a hassle
gets on top of the bounce and defends this into the leg side.
pulled all along the ground to deep square
chipped, but short of mid-on.
lunges forward and eases this full delivery to cover
another short ball on middle and leg, avoided.
another short ball, another leave
works this wide of midwicket for a quick single and that's tea
length around middle and leg, comes forward and defends it on the leg side
short of length on the pads, pushed towards short midwicket and sets off, he's in trouble there, a direct hit and he was on his way back
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards deep square leg
short of length outside off, pushed towards point
short of length on the pads, pushes it towards square leg for one more
short of length outside off and controlled plays a controlled pull towards midwicket
another short one to de Kock who pulls it towards deep square leg, he is not happy with the shot, maybe wanted to hit it for a boundary
short of length, angling into the body, defended down the wicket
short of length outside off, pushes it towards extra cover from the crease
a bouncer around off, Rabada ducks under it comfortably
bangs in short once more but it's down the leg side, doesn't bounces as much either
a low full toss on the pads, toe height, and Rabada has just chipped it straight to deep square leg, an easy catch for Oshada Fernando
length ball on the pads and flicked away towards deep square leg
short of length outside off, pushes at it, a thick outside edge towards point
length outside off, smashes it on the up towards the left of the bowler for four, off the mark in style
fuller on the stumps, looks to drive again down the ground, the ball hits the inner half and rolls towards mid-on
fuller outside off, and Styen plays another drive, the mid-off dives to his left and gets some hand to it to keep it to two
bouncer from Lakmal, in the line of the stumps, Steyn ducks under comfortably
another bouncer at de Kock who gets on the top of the bounce and pulls it towards deep backward square leg
a bouncer from around the wicket, Steyn stays away from the line
another short delivery but down the leg side this time, Steyn is not troubled
a low full toss outside off, backs away and hits it straight back, the bowler fails to stop it in his followthrough
a full toss down the leg side, Steyn goes for the flick but misses out on a freebie
length around leg stump, Steyn stays in his crease and defends it on the leg side
short of length on the stumps, goes back and pulls it towards deep midwicket to bring up his fifty
fuller on middle and leg, defends it back towards the bowler
on the pads this time, clipped away towards square leg
pitched up around middle and leg, flicks it towards short midwicket
length around off, goes back and across and turns it towards square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it back towards the bowler
a bouncer from around the wicket and de Kock this time places it perfectly, pulling it fine, the fielder there is very square and that gives a boundary
length around off, defends it from the back foot
short of length on the pads, looks to pull it hard, gets an inside edge on to the pads
fuller around off, looks to smash it down the ground, loses his shape and mistimes it towards midwicket, an inside edge on that occasion
length on middle and leg, flicked away in front of square
length on middle and leg, flicks it towards fine leg
lofted, even if he didn't get to the pitch. Long-off hared in, threw himself forward and saw this land just in front of him. Good work by the other debutant, may have picked it up a little late.
reverse-swept with some authority. Nice control, kept it all along the ground.

has he got him? May have lobbed off the back of the bat, to the slip fielder's hands via the keeper's pad. Surely there was a noise, okay, Dickwella has decided against a review, so he's clearly missed it. Normally he's up in a jiffy to appeal for anything and everything.
touch short, he goes back and across to whip it into the gap at deep midwicket
works this with the spin to deep midwicket
gets well forward and stabs with the bat well in front of the pad
whipped uppishly to deep midwicket
punches this short of length delivery to cover
punches this length delivery into the off side with soft hands
ripper of a bouncer that leaves Steyn in a hurry to get out of the way
drops his wrists and gets out of the way of this short ball again.
squirts this off a thick outside edge towards point
lunges forward and smothers this
drifts in and gets it to straighten on middle, defended
attacks the stumps with a length ball from round the stumps, Steyn defends by covering the line nicely
through the gate! This one doesn't turn, drifts in and skids on. Steyn goes for a big booming drive, but this slides through the gap to hit middle and leg.
spins away from outside off, left alone
fired full on the stumps, blocked.
slants a length ball back into the stumps, defended
helps it along to fine leg
slower length ball outside off, punched into the gap at cover
slower and fuller on the stumps, defended back
beaten on the pull, hits the back thigh and lobs to the slip cordon
helped along to third man where Thirimanne has put down an absolute dolly. De Kock arched back and simply used the bowler's pace to deflect. Straight in, straight out.
reverse swept in front of square. Ferocious! This was nicely tossed up, he premeditated and stuck it beautifully
works with the spin past midwicket
slides one back in, defended back
works this shortish delivery to short fine
driven with the spin to mid-off
nice flight, lands it on middle, he stabs it away
short and angling in, de Kock hammers this behind square, one bounce to the ropes.
reaches out to belt this full delivery to cover
slower and fuller on middle, de Kock picks it out of the hand instantly and muscles this over wide long-on. 101 metres. Massive hit, held his shape superbly.
top-edge as he tries to heave this, in the air for ages but fine leg calls, settles underneath it and takes it. Excellent from Vishwa Fernando, never easy as it was swirling around.
length around middle, goes for the flick, was in the air for a while but away from short leg
length around off, stays in the crease and defends it on the off side
fuller around off, defended from the crease once again
length again, around middle. A bit of hint of swing back, defended on the leg side
a leading edge towards point but nowhere near any fielder, short of length on middle and leg, looks to work on the leg side but plays a bit early
short of length around off, good bounce once again, defended towards covers
length around off, stays back and defends on the off side
short of length outside off, stays back and punches it through covers for four
length, just around fifth stump, Karunaratne covers his off stick before shouldering arms
short of length on middle and leg, chipped towards backward square leg, Maharaj from square leg chases it to keep it to one
length around off, stays in the crease and steers it towards gully
length, in the corridor, left alone
short of length but down the leg side, Karunaratne is not bothered
length around off, in the corridor, left alone
fuller around off and swinging back into the left-hander, comes forward and drives it past mid-on
short of length on the pads, tucks it away towards fine leg
back of length around off, gets on his toes and defends it towards backward point
short of length on the body, looks to defend on the leg side, a thick outside edge dribbles towards gully
a big shout for lbw but given not out. It was a length ball, swinging back to bat the defence and hit the batsman on the pads, but too high, tells replay
length around off, defended from the crease
fuller around off, Karunaratne is half forward, defends it towards cover
length around off, keeping a bit low here. Defended from the crease
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it back towards the bowler
length ball around middle, flicks it towards fine leg for one
short of length around off, stays back and punches it towards mid-on

a huge appeal for lbw, but denied. Bowling from wide of the crease to hit the batsman on the pads, in the line of the stumps but the angle would have taken it down the leg side. Replays show it was juts clipping the bails, would have been umpire's call on review
length outside off this time, Karunaratne pushes at it and gets beaten
driven towards mid-on this time, the fielder puts in a tumbling effort, makes a partial stop to keep it to two
length on middle, flicks it towards square leg, Markram makes a stop
length around off once more and Karunaratne once again works it towards Markram, no run there
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards square leg
fuller on the pads, misses the flick but will get a leg-bye to short fine leg, an appeal for lbw but was going down
length around off, tucks it away towards short midwicket, comes back for the second
length, in the corridor around fifth stump and well-left from the batsman
length around off once again, Karunaratne pushes at it this time, beaten
length on the pads, picked away towards deep square leg for two more
short of length around middle and leg, defends it solidly from the back foot
back of length, near the rib cage, dabs it down on the leg side
short of length in the rib cage, rising towards the batsman who defends it awkwardly and the ball lobs towards the right of de Kock, well away from him though
and that's a 15-ball duck for Thirimanne. Length, wide outside off, pushes at it, gets an outside edge and de Kock makes no mistake, takes it near knee height to his left
length but down the leg side, goes for the flick, misses
short of length around middle, extra bounce as well, Oshada manages to keep it down
fuller around off, pushes it back towards the bowler
fuller around off once again, pushes it back towards Philander
fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards midwicket for a couple
length around off, comes forward and defends with an angled bat, steers it towards gully
length on the middle, tucked away past square leg for two more
fuller around off, comes forward and defends towards cover
short of length around off, looks to defend, gets an inside edge on to the thigh
length around off, pushes it towards mid-off for a quick single
fuller around off, goes for the drive but misses
fuller once more, this time on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on
fuller again, in the corridor this time, comes forward before shouldering arms
length around off, stays back and flicks it towards midwicket
short of length outside off, sixth stump line, left alone
short of length around off once again, defends it on the off side
back of length outside off, pushes it towards mid-on off the back foot
length outside off, keeps low as Karunaratne looks to work it on the off side, on second bounce to de Kock
short of length outside off, coming back in with the angle, left alone
back of length outside off, pushes it towards covers
length outside off, gets this to nip away a hint, defended
angles a length ball back into the stumps from wide of the crease, defended
lifter, just outside off, Fernando gets back and across as he defends
another short ball on middle, awkward bounce but he somehow manages to keep it out
climbs in towards his arm pits, he somehow manages to get some bat to squeeze this down past leg gully
ducks under this short ball without much trouble
slants in a length ball on middle and leg, turned to the leg side
pulled, but no timing. Toe-ended to square leg
right back and across as he bunts this length delivery into the off side
tucked to short leg again with soft hands
allows this full delivery to slide into middle and leg and offers a straight bat to this 145kph thunderbolt
no control as he tries to hook this short ball, gets it off the glove as it rolls to where a short fine leg would be
short of length just outside off, he gets on top of the bounce and defends.
gets half a stride in as he defends this length ball on off stump
gets this to nip away a hint, but Fernando has the line well covered as he defends
takes the bottom hand off the bat handle as he defends this
dabs it into the off side, looks for a single but is sent back
pulled all along the ground towards deep square leg for a single
steps out and lofts him through the line, one bounce to the ropes. Didn't get to the pitch, wanted to go over mid-off but got it off a thickish inside-edge
beauty! Sharp turn and bounce as he lunges forward to block
drifting down leg, tickled away with the angle towards fine leg
driven firmly to extra cover
goes right back and across as he defends, this one kept a touch low.
skids straight on as it angles in, defended as light dims further
slow turn on middle and leg, tucked to deep square
drifts this too far down leg, he sweeps and misses. Keeper misses, Steyn gives it chase and hurls the throw
lunges forward and turns this back towards the bowler
lunges forward and drives to extra cover

tucks this wide of square leg, big mix-up and Steyn fired a throw to the bowler's end. Had Elgar collected it cleanly on the bounce and broken the stumps, Fernando would've been walking back. Karunaratne took three steps forward, stopped, then two steps forward and then turned his back on his partner. Very poor from the captain.
steps out and wallops this full toss across the line, one bounce to the deep midwicket boundary.
lunges forward and blocks this tossed up delivery
rocks back to cut, then waits for it to come to him and guides it past short third man
drifts this into middle and leg, tucked to short fine with the angle

nearly creates a wicket out of nothing! Looks to step out and hoick, gets a thick bottom edge that flies past leg stump. Not sure of this tactic of going after the bowling when caution is the need of the hour.
lunges forward and blocks
eases this gently to long-off
length ball on the pads and tucked away behind square, fifty comes up for Sri Lanka with that brace
a touch fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards covers
length around off, comes forward and offers a solid defence
sliding down the leg side once again, fails to connect the flick this time
length outside off, in the corridor, comes forward and offers a leave
a touch fuller and closer to the stumps, a bit of wobble as well but smothered on the front foot
starts with a length ball in the corridor, left alone
length once again, sixth stump line, shouldered arms
length, much closer to the batsman, making him play, defended on the front foot
once again that tight line, a touch fuller around off, stays in the crease, and defends it towards cover-point
length around middle and leg this time, tucked away towards square leg from the back foot
fuller on the stumps, pushed gently towards mid-on, a maiden to start the day for Philander
short of length outside off, left alone

and given lbw. Length around middle and leg, Oshada misses the flick and is rapped on the pads, a loud appeal and Aleem Dar raises the finger. Oshada is having a discussion with the skipper whether to review. They decide against it in the end but that would have been worth a review. Looked like it might have missed or just clipped the leg stump
length around off, a bit of shape in, left alone
length outside off, in the corridor, left alone
length around off, much closer to the stumps this time, a thick outside edge towards gully
length outside off, once again in the channel, Mendis leaves it alone
length around off, punched away between cover and point, two fielders chase it, a bit of tag team work to keep it to two
length around off, comes forward and defends
length around middle and leg, Karunaratne defends it on the leg side
length around off, nudges it towards covers, was looking to sneak in a single but none there

length around off and middle and swinging back to beat the bat, hits high on the thigh, a big appeal by the bowler, given not out but by this time Philander is at the other end. South Africa want to review this. Front foot first. Is there something behind the line? Very difficult to say. Zooming and zooming in further, looks like some molecule was behind the line. To the business end now. It pitched in line, but hit the batsman on the back thigh, going over the stumps. South Africa lose the review

fuller this time, on the leg stump, Karunaratne was looking to play something between a drive and a flick, misses altogether. And given this time. Karunaratne wants to review. Front foot is fine. No bat involved. Where did it pitch? Just in line. Where did it hit? Just in line, front pad first and then on to the back pad. Was it hitting the leg stump? Just, umpire's call. Karunaratne has to leave, I am afraid. Had it been given not out, it would have stayed not out
fuller outside off, comes forward and drive it towards cover, was in the air but short of Bavuma
length outside off, in the channel but very little bounce, de Kock collects at ankle height as Mendis shoulder arms
length again, in the corridor once more, Mendis leaves it alone
length on the stumps, coming in to the batsman this time, tucked away towards square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on
off the mark with a brilliant on-drive, fuller on the stumps, Mendis comes forward and presents the full face of the bat to send it the long-on boundary
beaten on the drive as he angles one across
cracker jack! Nips away off the seam as he drawn forward, beaten again
touch wide on off stump, moves away and he leaves
attacks the stumps with a fullish line, squirted off an inside edge to midwicket. Miss that and you're walking back
bounce off length on middle, nips in to hit him on the right elbow. Ouch, that will sting him for a while
overbalanced and struck on the pad as he tries to work it to the leg side, but this would've missed the stumps. Huge appeal, not given.
bouncer outside off, ducks under it
ducks back in a long way from outside off, left alone. Brave leave
nips away from the same spot - length outside off - left alone
gets half a stride in and defends
avoids this shortish delivery outside off, de Kock collects in front of his face
stands tall and bunts to the off side
hint of width outside off, eased behind point for a couple. Excellent work by Bavuma with the slide to prevent the boundary
zips past off stump, outstanding leave. Moved away appreciably
has a wild thrash at that, connects with thin air
right on top of the bounce as he defends
width and he's belted this up and over wide mid-off. Handy runs
in his half and he's flat-batted this through the vacant mid-off region
length on off, lofted over mid-off. No timing, but somehow gets it up and over. Runs coming now. Olivier was behind that on a wild goose chase, was never going to pull it back
squirts this short of length delivery into the off side
right behind the line as he blocks again
good leave as Steyn shortens his length and bowls just a touch outside off
slashed into the vacant third slip region, no third man so it's four. Loose delivery that deserved to be put away
check-punched to mid-on. One bounce
length on off, prods to get an inside edge onto the pad
tucks this wide of square leg for an easy single
beauty! Gets this to rise awkwardly as Kusal Mendis jabs but is beaten

edged and grabbed by a diving Faf, who takes it low as he moves to his left and in front of first slip. Squared him up with the length, Mendis had to play at that. Jabbed with hard hands. Faf's 50th catch in Tests
defends with his bat close to the pad
slants one across, left alone
crunching drive on the up, short cover in business for a while with the dive but couldn't get his hands on it
punches to short cover, authoritatively I must add
slants one away, pushed to cover point
defends back as this rolls off a thickish inside edge
Beaten for pace! Through with the pull but much after the pass passed him, de Kock with a one-handed grab on the leap
bunts this to cover again and it's time for drinks
length around off, looks to defend, a little inside edge on to the back leg
length around middle and leg, looks to push on the leg side, gets hit high on the thigh
length around off, drives it towards extra cover who makes a partial stop, mid-off tidies it up
length around off, Dickwella hangs his bat out, gets an outside edge but falls well short of du Plessis at second slip
length on middle and leg, tucked away fine by Dickwella to get a boundary to fine leg, was more like an edge but with that he's off the mark
length on middle and leg, swiped away towards fine leg, Olivier cuts it off
fuller on middle and leg, stays in the crease and defends back
fuller around off, pushes it away from the body, gets three as the ball goes towards third man
short of length, in the rib cage, tucks away towards fine leg, the fielder is square, sprints back for the second
length outside off, leaving the batsman who looks to smash it down the wicket, misses
length outside off, going away with the angle, Perera is rooted to the crease, pushes it at away from the body, beaten again
length around off, comes forward this time and taps it towards mid-off
starts with a length delivery down the leg side, too far away from the batsman to flick
short of length outside off, Dickwella stops midway through the pull, gets a top edge which carries easily to Steyn at very fine third man
bangs in halfway down, outside off, left alone
back of length around off, gets behind it and pushes it towards short midwicket
back of length around off, doesn't bounce that much, defended on the back foot
back of length on the pads, looks for the flick, the ball dribbles towards square leg
fuller but way outside off, Perera looks to jams his bat at it, misses. Too late
length around off this time, defended from the crease towards cover
fuller around off, tonks it over deep square leg, Maharaj is there a few yards inside, sails over him
length around off, punches it through covers for another couple of runs
almost in the blockhole, around off stump, jams his bat at it to dig it out towards covers
fuller around off, driven towards mid-off, the fielder is a bit back and that allows a quick single
another bouncer from Olivier, in the line of the stumps but Perera had no issues ducking under that
another short one, once again aimed at the batsman, ducked under comfortably
short of length on middle and leg, pulls it down towards deep square leg, 100 comes up for Sri Lanka
short of length around off, gets the batsman jumping who dabs it down, falls just short of the short leg fielder
short of length down the leg side, pulled away towards fine leg, Philander moves quickly to his right and prevents the boundary
back of length on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
gorgeous straight drive, but a little too straight, smashes onto the stumps at the bowler's end
squirts one off a thick edge to gully
top-edges a pull, lucky that it flies fine and carries all the way. There was a man who was a lot squarer, couldn't have had a chance. Lucky runs for Sri Lanka as they eat into the deficit
ripper! Honing in towards middle, he sways out of the way of this short ball
looks to whip it square but this was sliding down leg
right back into the crease as he blocks
too short, way down leg, avoided.
nice and full on leg stump, defends with a closed bat face, rolls towards the off side
slashed over backward point. Too much width, he reached out to play it uppishly over the fielder
hops back into the crease and blocks
punched uppishly to cover point
squirts this off a thick inside edge to midwicket
slips this down leg, looks to tickle fine but misses
right back and across as he allows the length ball to slide back in
stays besides the line in defence. 147kph this time
flicked well but down to long leg
slapped uppishly into the gap between cover and point. Just a hint of width and he went after that wholeheartedly
pulls and misses. Too quick for him
stands tall and punches this into the covers
too much width, he uses it to ease straight to point
hops back to nearly smell leather as he defends
tucks this off his hip wide of midwicket
short of length on leg stump, Perera hops across and bunts it behind square. Rapped on the glove as he tried to negotiate that
gloves this pull to the fine leg fence, Steyn a mere spectator.
touch fuller a he slants one on off, defended
keeps low as it angles in on a length from wide of the crease, Dhanajaya hopped back but somehow adjusted to keep that away.
pokes and gets a thick edge past gully.Did well to loosen the grip so that this went to ground. Irritating runs for the fielding side
imperious pull! Fetched it from outside off, picked the gap at midwicket. Too short, sat up nicely. Well executed
sways out of the way of this bouncer
tucked to deep square, Perera wanted the second, Dhananjaya wasn't keen
too full and angling in, turned to short leg
too full, drifting into the pads, blocked
squirts off a thick inside edge to Steyn at fine leg, playing outside the line. Can be dangerous
late cut past short third man. Looked to step out but bailed out in the end and just deflected it
nice and full on the stumps, kept out
punches this fuller delivery into the covers
off a thick inside edge towards fine leg
touch full, just around off, gets forward and defends.
squirts this off the outer part of the bat to backward point

Ends up top-edging it and Olivier, at fine leg, runs across to his left and settles underneath it to take a superb catch. Poor batting, poor execution right at the stroke of lunch.
fuller outside off and driven handsomely through covers for a boundary, what a way to resume
short of length outside off and cracked away through point, Maharaj puts in the chase
a nippy bouncer around off, bowled slight wide of the crease, Lakmal does well to sway away from it
short of length outside off, taps it towards covers
short of length outside off, goes for the pull but manages only a semi-forehand, just gets it over Rabada at short midwicket
another short one, goes for the pull, gets a glove and ends up lobbing it in the air, de Kock sprints it to his right but the ball evades him
short again, pulls it over square leg this time, not in the control at all as he takes his eyes off at the point of contact
length around off and chips it straight to Markram at short extra cover, who takes it around face height. That's the third wicket for Steyn and Sri Lanka are 142 for 7
short of length, around fifth stump but doesn't bounces much, left alone by the batsman
bouncer this time, well-directed, Embuldeniya ducks under easily though
short of length outside off, hangs his bat out but luckily doesn't get an edge
short of length outside off, looks to duck but realises it's quite wide outside off
short of length at the batsman, he has taken his eyes off and looks to duck, struck on the helmet but looks okay
short of length down the leg side, pulls it towards fine leg but denies the single
short again, in the body, defends it from the back foot
length around middle and off, moves across and turns it towards square leg
bouncer again, but too high this time, sails over the batsman, called a wide
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg, takes the single, leaving Embuldeniya to face two balls
short of length, just outside off, Embuldeniya looks to defend but gets beaten
short of length in the rib cage, dabs it towards fine leg, but they deny the single. So Embuldeniya will have to wait for his first Test run
length around off, works it towards backward square leg but doesn't take the run
short of length outside off, swivels to pull it between two deep square legs gets a boundary, great timing and placement
short of length outside off, rises on the toes and defends on the off side
fuller, slower one outside off, looks to put bat on it, misses, awkward bounce to de Kock who does well to get behind it
bouncer, aimed at the batsman who ducks under
length around off and smashed in front of square for four, gets to his fifty, but that means Embuldeniya will be on strike in the next over
a bouncer as expected but down the leg side, Embuldeniya was once again looking to duck
length around off, stays leg side of the ball and defends it towards the bowler
length around middle and leg, defended down the wicket once again
short of length at the batsman, once again he takes his eyes off the ball and gets hit on the chest guard, this is not the way to play short stuff
another bouncer but this one is high enough for Embuldeniya to duck under without getting hit
short of length outside off, gets behind it and defends it on the off side
length around off, lofts it towards long-off, not the best of the timings, both batsmen were almost crossing each other midway before Perera sends his partner back
length around off, defends it towards covers
fuller outside off, backs away and looks to loft it over extra cover, ends up slicing it instead, Hamza is halfway at deep extra cover, makes good ground to his left before pouching it
back of length on middle, stabbed away from the crease
beauty! Just nibbles around off stump, zips past the outside edge as he plays inside the line
drops his wrists and gets out of the way of this short ball
stands tall and punches this into the gap behind point
pokes at a lifter outside off, beaten for pace
bunts this down the ground for an easy single
angles a length ball across, he opens the bat face to steer this wide of fully. Off the mark in Tests, finally. Has taken some painful blows along the way. Two hits on the helmet.
looks to tickle this length ball fine but misses. Swerved away so late that de Kock had to put his left glove out and then dive to stop that.
banged in short, he looks to pull, top-edge and over the slips to the third man boundary
hops back and blocks
jabs this into the gap at point
mistimes a drive to mid-off
takes his eyes off this bouncer and gets rapped on the glove. Living dangerously, he's going to have bruises all over his body tonight at this rate
hops back and blocks this length ball on the stumps
beauty! Another short ball on middle, somehow manages to get his gloves out of the way.
beaten as he attempts to glide this short ball over point
right onto his toes as he blocks
stays besides the line to defend this 138kph length ball
right into the blockhole, jams his bat down to squeeze it past the bowler
length on leg side, misses the tickle. Thuds into de Kock's gloves
beaten on the pull as he tries to fetch one from outside off
short ball, quick, Rajitha scrambles to block
jabs this by getting besides the line
jumps across and defends this bouncer
worked off his hip to fine leg
short of length on off, kept out
squared up by one that leaves him late. Cracking delivery!
hops to the leg side to defend this length ball on off to the covers
attacks the stumps but strays down leg in the process, tucked to long leg
this time he works this to the left of short leg. Uppish, wasn't in control but gets away
too short and down leg, misses as he attempts a glide down leg
opens the bat face slightly as he hops back, squirted wide of gully
excellent bouncer aimed at the arm pits, Lakmal looks away and tries to get the bat out of the way as he tries and blocks and is hit on the elbow
hurried by this super sharp short ball. Caught between a short-arm jab and a leave, ball thuds into the top part of the bat and lobs to the off side
too much width, he punches this on the up, the timing so sublime that the cover point fielder gave up the chase very early. Beautiful
No gully, and four! Edged and into the gap between third slip and point. Steam coming out of Steyn's ears
gets on top of the bounce and blocks
jabs hard, lobs into the off side but no one to catch that close, at silly mid-off
tucks this behind square for an easy single. Long leg comes in to stop
looks to get besides, manufacture room and upper cut, but is beaten for pace
right into the blockhole, kept out
punches into the gap at extra cover as they scamper a run
too short and down leg, avoided without much fuss
angles a short ball across, defended with soft hands
awkward fend to a bouncer, briefly in the air but lands short of short leg.
length around off, stays back and pushes it towards backward point
short of length around middle, fends at it and gets struck near the armpit
Elgar has put it down. It was a short of length outside off, Rajitha fends and spoons it towards gully, Elgar cannot hold on to that
short of length at the batsman who takes his eyes off once again and gets hit on the helmet. Physio is out and is tending to him, he looks fine. A change of helmet it seems.
short of length outside off, in the corridor, left alone
short of length around off, stays back and drops it towards point, steals a single
short of length around middle and leg, pushes it towards covers
short of length around middle this time, stays back and defends it back
length around middle and leg, angling away from the batsman, pushed towards point
a bouncer from Rabada, but down the leg side, Embuldeniya stays away from it
almost a yorker around off, does well to get his bat down in time, on the full and off to the shoe
fuller again, just outside off, looks to push at it, gets beaten
short of length but down the leg side, looks to tuck it away, misses
short of length on middle and leg, tucks it away in front of square, scampers back for the second
short of length on middle and leg once again, looks to work it on the leg side, misses and the ball lobs towards silly point off the thigh
short of length in the rib cage, gets on his toes and drops it down
short of length down the leg side, helps it towards the left of the keeper for one
short of length outside off, some room as well, Embuldeniya goes for the cut but misses out
length around off, Rajitha is stuck in the crease, pushes at it and gets beaten. Wasn't far from off stump either
short of length outside off, pushes at it, the ball hits the outer half and bounces well in front of the point fielder

and a run-out finally breaks the stand! Short of length on middle and leg, Rajitha drops it towards short leg and looks to set off for a single but Markram collects it and breaks the stumps with a direct it. The batsman tried to get back but the throw beat him
fuller around off, pushes it towards extra cover for a quick single
length around off, stays the leg side of the ball, steers it towards backward point
a bouncer but way outside off, stays away from the line
short of length around middle and off, Embuldeniya bends his back and looks to dab it over slips, fails to connect
short again, outside off this time, steered towards backward point
fuller around off, stays back but smashes it hard but silly point comes in the way and takes a blow on his right leg, Markram there
short of length outside off, once again takes his eyes off and looks to duck, but this is well away from him
short of length at the batsman, who looks to pull it away, misses
short of length at the batsman who backs away and ends up pushing it back towards the bowler
sliding down leg, worked to fine leg
slips in a yorker, just whizzes past the off stump as he tries to squeeze this into the off side
gloves it to the keeper? Nah, not quite. Umpire reckons it brushed the shoulder. Good bouncer

full toss angling away, throws his bat at it and gets a thick edge that races wide of point.
beaten on the pull. Looked to clobber it high but got no bat. Too much pace to try that
ducks under this bouncer on middle
looks to sway out of the way but dangles his bat out, almost as if to play an upper cut. Misses
beaten as he has a waft at a length ball outside off
full and straight on the stumps, he's squared up anticipating a bouncer but somehow manages to get behind the line and block
beaten as he wafts outside off, top bowling
drops his wrists and gets out of the way of this bouncer
beaten high and dry, superb full delivery. Suckerpunched him nearly. Goes to the batsman and fist-bumps him. This was 147kph
makes room to loft over cover, ends up mistiming it and Steyn does well to move to his right from mid-off to pluck that.
short of length on the pads, tucks it away towards fine leg and gets off the mark
back of length around off, stays back and defends it on the off side
length around off, leaving the  batsman after pitching, left alone by Markram
short of length outside off, rises on his toes and punches it through covers for a couple
short of length around, stays back and defends with a straight bat

length outside off, wide again and moves further away after landing
short of length around off, leaves the batsman once again after landing, no shot attempted
short of length outside off, leaves it alone once again
length, in the corridor, lets it go through the keeper, nice carry to Dickwella

length around off, punched towards extra cover, a good stop by the fielder, jumping to his left as it bounces off the practice pitches
short of length around middle and leg, flicked away but straight towards short midwicket
short of length outside off, punched off the back foot past the mid-on fielder for four
short of length around off, pushes it towards square leg for a quick single
back of length outside off, punches it from the back foot through covers, flicked just inside the boundary line by the chasing fielder
short of length outside off, in the corridor, shouldered arms

fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards sweeper cover
length around off, once again moving away from the left-hander, left alone

short of length this time, keeps coming in with the angle and puts Elgar in a tangle, dabs it on the leg side
