rocks back to cut but this one skids through, kept a touch low to beat the under-edge and crash into the stumps.
jabs this away with the bat well in front of the pad
fired full on the stumps, squeezed to the leg side.
back of a length on middle and leg, worked to deep square
squared up by the length, right shoulder facing the bowler as he defends
mistimes this drive to mid-off
ducks under this short ball that doesn't rise as much as Maharaj may have expected
good ball! Excellent yorker, honing in towards his toe. Got this to tail in late, Maharaj is off balance as he somehow scrambles to get some bat on it.
beaten as he attempts a tickle down leg.
mistimes a cut to cover
goes back and across, defends
squirts a thick outside edge to backward point, nice flight and dip, was looking to drive
sharp turn off the rough on leg stump, Faf is squared up as he gets a thick edge on the bounce to slip
tossed up outside leg, pads it away
lunges forward and plays late. Sharp turn on this as well.
too short, enough width and he uses the depth of the crease to punch it on the up to deep extra cover
bunts this short of length delivery to cover
attacks the stumps with a length ball, worked to square leg
skids one through on a length, just around off, Faf has a jab to get an inside edge onto the pad

cuts back in really late to hit Faf high on the pad, but he was so deep inside the crease that the ball didn't have much to travel. Big appeal but this, replays confirm, would've certainly missed the stumps. Excellent decision by Kettleborough

indecision, indecision. He probed and probed away, beat him on the outside edge a number of times, troubled him with the inducker and now finally has him! What an inspired effort. Vishwa gets this to nip back in off the seam from length outside off, Faf isn't sure if this is going to move in so leaves, and to his horror sees the ball come back in a long way to hit him just below the knee roll. Straightforward decision.
short of length outside off, goes for the cut and misses
short again, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
length around off and spins in sharply, Rabada pushes at it, and the ball lobs towards short leg who had a couple of goes at it before grassing it eventually

A fifer for Embuldeniya. A similar delivery, length around off and sharp turn, Rabada looks to work it on the leg side, gets beaten, the ball brushes the thigh and lobs towards the keeper's right who takes it and appeals for the caught-behind. Yes, says the umpire, it probably brushed the glove on its way on to the thigh
fuller around off and middle, defended
length ball, Steyn stays back and blocks again
length around off and middle, Maharaj gets behind it and blocks

nips back sharply to disturb the stumps. That's four wickets for five runs for Sri Lanka. Was a length ball, angling in, Maharaj looked to push at it, played all around and the ball sneaked in to hit the off bail
length around off, in the corridor, left alone
short of length around off, looks to defend from the back foot, a thick outside edge goes towards gully
short of length outside off, left alone, lobs towards the keeper
length on the pads, tucks it towards square leg
slower in the air, fuller around middle and leg, defended
short of length on the stumps, punched back towards the bowler
short of length on leg and middle, whips it towards midwicket
length on the stumps, flicks it towards square leg
short of length outside off, punched off the back foot towards deep extra cover for a couple
length but on the pads, looks to defend but the ball keeps going with the angle and lobs towards short fine leg off the pad
and that's it. Fuller on middle and leg, and Steyn, was already standing on the off stump, moves across towards the off side and looks to flick, misses and it's timber
length ball on the pads from around the wicket, flicked towards fine leg to get off the mark
length around off and middle, defended from the front foot
length around off, looks to defend on the off side, an inside edge takes the ball towards square leg
short of length on the hips, tucks it away towards fine leg, off the mark
a bouncer from Steyn this time, Karunaratne had no issue in ducking under it
length around off, comes forward and pushes it on the leg side
length around off, in the corridor and moving away from the batsman, left alone
length around off, comes forward and defends it towards mid-off
short of length around off, pushes at it, gets an outside edge and it flies over the slip cordon. A got out in the similar manner in the first innings
length around off, comes forward and defends
length again, in the channel, Thirimanne looks to defend but ends up playing inside the line, on the bounce to the keeper
a touch fuller this time, goes for the drive but mistimes it towards the right of the mid-off fielder
short of length delivery on middle, hint of movement, defended
swerves in late, length quite full, squirted off a thick inside edge to midwicket
lifter, awkwardly fended to the leg side as he was looking to get on top of the bounce. Lobbed, but fell just short of short midwicket
neatly tucked round the corner to fine leg as he got on top of the bounce
punches away from the body, and into the gap at point for a single.
too full on the pads, neatly worked to fine leg
hit on the thigh pad as he looks to work to the leg side. Beaten by the fizz on the delivery
nice and full on the stumps, hint of movement away but Thiri has the line well covered
gets this to move away appreciably off the seam but Thiri is solidly behind the line of this length ball.
beauty! Nibbling around fourth stump, had to play at that. Beaten
just keeps bowling at the same spot. Just a touch ahead of length, closer to the batsman, and around off stump. Pokes and misses
defends this length delivery from the crease.
works this short of length delivery wide of midwicket. Hopped back and played it confidently even as it was rising.
shapes to drive but is uncertain, ends up hanging his bat out to get an inside-edge onto the pad.
beauty! Gets him to play by angling it in from round the wicket, Thiri beaten as he pokes at one that squares him up. He's playing for one that moves away.
this is much fuller, Karunaratne rooted to the crease as he squirts it to the off side.
gets besides the line and bunts this length delivery into the off side
lovely wrist work. Too straight this time and he works this through the vacant mid-on region.
around the off-stump channel, much fuller, left alone
back of length on off stump, defended into the covers.
nudges this off the pads into the gap at square leg.
much fuller and angling away, invitation there to poke but Dimuth says no thanks.
fuller and closer to off-stump, defended
leans to caress this full delivery to mid-off
this one zips off a length but keeps a touch low, defended nonetheless
pulled away imperiously in front of square. Fetched it from outside off, and was in total control.
uses the width to steer this wide of point, Bavuma with a long chase to pull it back in
beautifully punched on the up. Just a hint of width and he hopped back to ease it into the covers. Solid so far, runs chugging along very nicely.
defends this length ball with his bat close to the body.
loose shot, chases this wide delivery but fortunately for Sri Lanka's sake, he misses. This close to being nicked off Got to say though that this was there for the cut
has he taken him? Yes, but that lobbed off the pad. Sharp turn though and that will encourage Kesh
turns sharp but the length is on the shorter side, tucked towards midwicket
slow turn from off stump, defended with the spin
goes right back into the crease and works it towards Rabada at deep midwicket
slider on off, he goes back and across to block
steps out and whips this with the spin to long-on and that's tea
length around off, goes back and flicks it towards square leg
length around off and middle this time, defends it back towards the bowler
length around off, comes back a little bit to sneak in between the bats and the thigh, passes over the stumps
length around off and this one has gone the other way, Karunaratne was pushing at it, gets beaten. This is the Philander magic
length around off, 131kph, Karunaratne was looking to defend, gets beaten again as it moves away from the batsman
fuller outside off, comes forward and leaves it, swing back after it passes the stumps
length around off, moves after off the seam to beat the defensive push
back of length on the body, gets on his toes and dabs it down towards short leg
length around off and middle, gets behind the line and defends with a straight bat
a touch fuller around off, comes forward and defends it with soft hands, towards cover
banged in short but down the leg side, too high as well, Thirimanne ducks under easily

no one goes for it. Fuller outside off, flashes hard at it, a thick outside edge flies between du Plessis and Elgar at head height, at second and third slip. They are standing way too close it looks like but still was Elgar's catch
length on middle and leg, flicked away uppishly past the square leg fielder for a brace
length around off, defended on the off side
length on the pads, goes for the flick, misses but will get a leg-bye
length around fourth stump line, Thirimanne leaves it alone, comes back a little but not enough to hit the off stump
length in the corridor, left alone once more
fuller around off, comes forward and defends
short of length, angling into the batsman, pushes it towards mid-on
a touch fuller around off, Karunaratne was on the back foot, defends it down the wicket
short of length on the body, tucked away behind square on the leg side
another down-the-leg-side bouncer from Rabada, Thirimanne is not bothered
short of length around off, gets on his toes and defends it towards extra cover
fuller around off, defends it towards point
length around off, stays in the crease and defends it back towards the bowler
length around off, defended down the wicket with a vertical bat once more
length, on middle and leg this time, flicked away towards fine leg
length around middle and leg once again, flicks it towards square leg
length on middle and leg, dabs it towards short midwicket
fuller around off, throws his bat it, not often you see such a shot from Karunaratne, gets beaten
length around off, defended towards cover-point
fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards short midwicket
length around off, some extra bounce, plays it well, taking off the bottom hand and steering it towards point
length around off, comes forward and defends
fuller on the stumps, drives it back straight towards the bowler
short of length on the pads, looks to flick but misses, gets hit above the knee roll
a touch fuller around off, comes forward to defend, gets surprised by the extra bounce even though he defends it fine taking off the bottom hand

length around off, Karunaratne shoulders arm but it comes just back in to hit the batsman on the back pad. A big appeal for lbw denied. South Africa want to review it, the impact is outside off but he was not playing a shot. But it hasn't come back in enough and was missing the stumps by quite some distance. South Africa lose the review
crisp flick, fuller on the stumps and flicked away through midwicket for a boundary
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
gets half a stride in and defends confidently
yorker-length on the stumps, turned towards short midwicket
gets on top of the bounce and fends carefully
shows the full face of the bat and bunts this away-going length delivery into the off side.

big booming drive, as if he's doing so at the SSC! Rabada goes round the stumps and angles a length ball on the fourth stump, Thiri is tempted and goes after that one but is clearly late on it, gets a thick edge and Faf dives across to his right, in front of Amla at first slip, to pouch this superb catch.
steers this length delivery to backward point
crisp little drive but straight to mid-off
right behind the line of this length ball on the stumps as he defends.

huge appeal and gone! There's the second. Dimuth refers upstairs. This is short of length on middle, nips back in and skids through to beat the inside edge as he plays all around it. Looked good to smash leg stump. Replays tell us this would've clipped the bail on leg stump so the umpire's call will stay
minute deviation off the deck will cause much trouble to batsmen when Philander is on. This one just about leaves him enough to whizz past the edge after drawing him forward. Cracker first up.
walks into the shot and then bunts this back towards the bowler.
shimmies down the pitch to counter the movement as he drives to mid-on
slips in a full ball, almost yorker length, on the stumps, squeezed out.
gets on top of the bounce and bunts this wide of point, there's an overthrow at the striker's end as they take an extra run
slants this full delivery into the stumps, defended back
has an ugly waft at the delivery, ends up getting a thick inside edge that flies past off-stump t the fine leg boundary. On another day, he would've chopped on
confidently punched into the gap behind point, races away. Deliberately opened the bat face late to pick the gap.
hops back and defends with soft hands
hustles him with a length ball on the stumps, tucks this wide of short leg
hops back and across as he bunts this back towards the bowler
too early into the pull, much before the ball arrived. Beaten
too short on the stumps, ducks under this without any hassle

has he nicked him? Yes, he has. Poor from Kusal Mendis, why would you look to glide a quick bowler off a short ball? This one climbs on him, looks to deflect this over the cordon but is late on the stroke and de Kock takes an excellent catch on the leap. Sri Lanka are unravelling very quickly after a glimmer of hope at the start. Got to show more desire than that, Kusal.
quick bouncer again, raps him on the glove as he looks to nudge this into the leg side.
driven on the up into the gap between cover and mid-off, good running
leading edge, flies into the gap past gully! Looks to go with hard hands, bat facing mid-on but the ball swerves away late to take the outside edge.
nips back in off a length to hit him on the back thigh.
stands tall and bunts this into the off side.
goes right back and across to defend this back to the bowler.
punched on the up to backward point, Maharaj swoops in quickly but they scamper a single
mistimes a short-arm jab to midwicket, looking to take the bowler on.
works this behind square to fine leg
Oh, dear. Goes after the pull, top-edges it but gets away. Rabada is too fine at long leg. Comes around to cut it off but even a dive wouldn't have got him close to the ball. Lucky break
right on top of the bounce as he gets onto the toes, defended.
pulled away, down to Maharaj at deep square
shapes to hook but realises this is a touch too step, tries to bail out and gets into an awkward position, but no damage done.
starts the over with a short one around off, Fernando sways away from it
short of length around off, stays back and tucks it towards square leg
short of length around off, defends it towards covers from the back foot
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover this time
short of length around off, 140kph pushed towards point, was in the air for a while
fuller around off at 141kph and and lofted over mid-off, no fuss about that, all hands
a bouncer at the batsman in excess of 140 kph, ducked under
lands just in front of de Kock, short of length around off, Fernando was looking it steer it away, the ball hits him on the glove but doesn't carry
length outside off, steered towards gully
short of length around off, goes for a pull but doesn't time it well, on the bounce towards short midwicket
short of length around off, 136kph, gets behind this and blocks
short one again, around middle and leg this time, swivels to pull it towards square leg
length around off, sweeps it towards backward square leg

fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers for a quick single, Steyn with the throw, misses the stumps. Had he hit, it would have been out. The batsman had jammed his bat before the crease and dropped it. No part of his body was grounded behind the crease
fuller down the leg side, sweeps it fine and hard and collects a boundary
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
a touch flatter at 81kph, defended on the front foot once again
fuller around off and middle, 87kph, dead-bats it again
short of length and going across the left-hander, who pushes at it and gets beaten
short of length in the rib cage, drops his bottom hand and tucks it towards fine leg
another short one but angling down the leg side, Fernando shoulders arms, a mild appeal for caught-behind but it brushed the body on its way
short of length around off, waits for it and looks to steer it late, past the slip cordon maybe. Gets beaten
another short one, down the leg side, moves inside the line and leaves it alone. Looks like it once again brushed his shirt
short of length around middle and leg, dabs it towards backward square leg
goes for the sweep but Markram at short leg come in the way
fuller around off, pushes it towards covers
short of length, pulls it towards short midwicket
short of length, flicks it towards fine leg for a single
short of length around off, gives himself some room and steers it towards point
length ball down the leg side, worked towards square leg
short of length outside off, punches it off the back foot towards sweeper cover
length around off, stays back and defends
length on the stumps, a reverse sweep towards third man, a bit of chase for Philander
fuller on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
length around off, comes forward and defends
length around off, spinning in, stays back and blocks
fuller around off, comes forward and defends
flatter on the stumps, some spin back in, defended from the back foot again
use of feet and smashed along the ground, Maharaj gets a hand to it and deflects it towards mid-off
length around middle, defended with a straight back
short of length outside off, punched off the back foot through covers
and he finds a touch of extra lift outside off first up, Fernando hopping to counter it in defence
flying through in the channel, outside off, and the batsman has a good look and lets it go
Fernando presses half forward in defence to a fuller one, sending the ball to Markram at short leg, on the bounce
Rabada hits a length, just outside off, and Fernando offers solid defence. There's been no early swing or seam movement so far
Rabada keeps things tight on off stump, and this time Fernando's defensive push goes to gully
nicely full and honing in on the off stump to test Fernando's defence, which holds firm
angled across on a length, Perera stepping forward to push to cover
speared down the leg side, precious little swing for Steyn
first runs of the morning for Fernando, who steps forward into a drive and angles his bat to get the ball past point, and they're back for a third
decent nip from Steyn at 143km/h, and Perera hops to flick off his hip and down to fine leg
Fernando checks his drive at the very last moment as Steyn continues to pitch it up, very nearly spooning the ball into the gully. He stopped the stroke just in time
nice end to the over from Steyn, aiming for the top of off to test Fernando's defence. Probing stuff so far from South Africa's quicks, despite the lack of swing
landing on leg stump on a full length, and Perera nudges it into the leg side
pitched up again, but outside off stump this time and Perera slugs the ball in the air down the ground. The ball plugs in the soggy outfield, so they're kept to three. Brave shot
Rabada pulls his length back a touch, and Fernando is half forward as he defends from the crease
Rabada sprints in and targets Fernando's pads with a full ball, the batsman nudging to midwicket to ooh's and aah's behind the stumps
Rabada has got his radar right early this morning, and once again he makes Fernando play on an off stump line
nicely full again, and Rabada hops in his follow through to stop Fernando's drive, one-handed
Steyn is giving nothing away either, hitting a length on or around off stump to draw a defensive push from Perera
just a hint of shape back in to the left hander through the air, but it's easily dealt with
Perera's taken by surprise by one from Steyn that spits off a length, taking his bottom hand off the bat as he pushes defensively at it
metronomic start from Steyn, and Perera presses half forward to a length delivery on middle and off
Steyn aims for the magic ball, full and zipping in to Fernando's pads, but he gets some bat on it to collect a single to fine leg
Steyn fires down a rising delivery outside off that Perera meets with a slightly ungainly hack, but he places the ball well enough to collect another single
Rabada errs ever so slightly in line, slipping one down towards Perera's legs, and he collects an easy single to fine leg
as the sun peeps out briefly from behind the clouds, Fernando has a good look and lets a full ball go outside off
out of nowhere, he's beaten on the outside edge! It was the line, really, that prompted the miss, perfectly in the channel outside off
has this tailed in a touch? Rabada might be getting a little reverse swing, but it does too much and hoops down the leg side, flicking the boot on the way to the boundary
Fernando is elegantly forward to drive a full one to short extra cover, keeping his elbow nice and high as he does so
beaten again! Rabada really bent his back on this one, the ball zipping through at 146km/h and bursting past Fernando's outside edge

close! Rabada is at a very deep mid off, and had he been orthodox this would have been popped straight to him. Steyn pitches it up, and Perera takes the bait with a lofted drive. Fortunately for him, he mistimed it horribly
and Fernando is the antithesis, all watchful defence as Steyn hits a length on off stump
fuller this time, and a touch wider too as Fernando stretches forward to defend
Steyn lowers his pace to 135km/h and finds some away shape as a result, but Fernando spots it and covers the swing as he defends
Fernando presents the full face to keep a full one out, resolute stuff
just a little wider of off this time, testing Fernando's judgement. He chooses to push out defensively at it, taking the bottom hand off the bat as he does so
Rabada shoots one across Perera's bows, on a length, and he's on his tip-toes to defend into the leg side
nudged off the toes, and an easy single to fine leg
full outside off, but Fernando won't be tempted into a drive, defending to point
outside off, and wide enough that Fernando doesn't need to play at it
some shape back in to the right hander, but he's solidly behind it to defend

Fernando's got his forward defence in good working order, and also his on drive. One of the hardest shots to play, against the world's top ranked Test bowler, and Fernando plays it sublimely to pick up four and bring up the fifty stand
scythed through point! Fernando is all elegance, Perera is more about power and flair, hopping to slash a cut at a short ball, hitting it in the air but wide of any fielder
Steyn adjusts his line, aiming closer to off stump, and Perera defends
fuller this time, and again Perera is forward to defend
Perera lets this one go outside off
hint of shape away from the left-handed Perera, who is half forward to defend
a chopped cut sends the ball hard into the turf and bouncing into Rabada's hands at point. Missed opportunity for runs there
Rabada offers width outside off on a full length, and Fernando rolls his hands over a drive that's intercepted at point. Good looking shot for no runs
a tempter, slightly wider outside off, but Fernando opts for patience and lets it go
Rabada digs this one in, and though there's no great pace in the pitch Fernando is still a little rushed as he ducks underneath it, dropping the hands too
Fernando shoulders arms once more to one wide outside off
Rabada shoots down a surprise yorker, and once again the ball tails in slightly through the air, but Fernando watches it closely and trusts his forward defence to keep it out
another attempted yorker, but this one slips out as a low full toss that's nudged to fine leg
full and aimed at off stump, and Fernando defends to extra cover

edged, and gone! Fernando's judgement had been so good so far, but it's failed him this time as he follows a cross-seamed delivery that nips away a touch off the track. The ball was full and in the channel, but where previous deliveries have shot straight through this one left him and he couldn't withdraw the bat. He could have left it alone without any danger
yelps of excitement from the slips as Steyn bursts a back of a length delivery past Dickwella, who drops his hands as the ball shoots past him

two wickets in three balls for Steyn! A full ball just stopped very slightly in the surface as a flat-footed Dickwella pushed at it with hard hands. He was too early into the shot and popped the ball straight back at Steyn, who plucked it out of the air one handed
full just outside off, and the ball keeps slightly low to hit the bottom of Dhananjaya's bat
pressed to mid on with a drive, and that brings a breakthrough over to an end
seaming across the left hander, but from a leg stump line and it's nurdled to leg
Perera is forward this time, driving to short extra cover
Rabada tests Perera with a short ball, with deep square leg in position, but he rolls his wrists on the stroke and also gets it well in front of square to collect four
Rabada switches to around the wicket, and zings down a very zippy bouncer that Perera hustles to get underneath of
a punchy drive to mid off brings a single, and a slightly wild return throw offers the chance for a second run
another short one, and again Perera ducks underneath it
Steyn offers up a half volley just outside off to invite the drive, but Dhananjaya's drive goes straight to mid off
just short of a good length this time, and Dhananjaya doesn't like it, taking his bottom hand off the bat to fend to fine leg
Perera jumps to cut a short one, and bottom edges it through to de Kock, on the bounce
short and rising on a leg stump line, Perera swiveling through a pull and also managing to keep it down, straight to fine leg
in the channel, outside off, and Dhananjaya raises his hands over the ball to leave it alone
and again, just a hint of away shape and Dhananjaya wants nothing to do with it, shouldering arms
and it is indeed short to start, but passing harmlessly past Perera's armpit down the leg side
Olivier bangs it in in his own half, and Perera ducks under a ball that leaps over him but dies on its way through to the keeper
back of a length, and headed down the leg side as it flicks Perera's thigh pad. A good stop from de Kock saves runs
width offered outside off, but Perera mistimes his cut and it goes nowhere
this time Perera goes after the short one, but he controls the shot by rolling his wrists over it. There are two men out on the leg side so the lofted pull is definitely not on
short, and rising on a middle and leg stump line, Dhananjaya standing tall to meet it and pull but picking out square leg with his shot
pushed through the channel outside off at a decent clip, and Perera defends

inside edge past the stumps! Steyn fired this one down much fuller, aiming for middle stump, and Perera was a little late getting his bat down to it, the ball taking the inside edge and flying just past the stumps down to the boundary
Perera is rooted to the crease as he punches a length delivery softly to cover
full and straight, and this time Perera's defence holds firm
short and wide, and Perera holds nothing back as he flings his hands through a rasping cut. He hit the ball in the air, but fiercely hard and over a leaping Bavuma
straighter from Steyn, and Perera opts to defend
short of length outside off, 135 kph, pulls it away towards deep midwicket
another short of length outside off, bounces only knee height this time, adjusts to pull it towards square leg for one
short of length, rising towards the rib cage of the left-hander, stands tall and drops it down
once again short of length, a rising delivery towards the batsman, defended from the back foot
short of length around off, angling in towards the batsman who chops it towards the point fielder
similar length once again but this one is on middle and leg, tucks it towards square leg
brings out the reverse sweep straightaway, length outside off and spinning in, played towards third man
length outside off, a little bit of turn, keeps low as well, de Silva looks to defend and gets beaten
use of feet this time, not perfectly to the pitch of the ball, but manages to clear mid-off, collects a brace
flatter and quicker on the stumps, defended from the crease
a touch fuller around off, comes forward and blocks again
length ball on the pads, comes forward and glances it gently towards short fine leg
short of length but down the leg side, doesn't bounce as high as Perera expected. He actually ducked
short of length, angling across the left-hander this time, sways away. Good bounce and carry this time
length ball on the pads, looks to play straight but the ball hits the inner half and rolls towards fine leg
short of length outside off, was looking for a pull initially but it's too high, drops the idea in the end
short of length around off, jumps and pushes it towards point
short again, down the leg side, away from the batsman as he stays inside the line of the ball
this is a freebie. Short and wide outside off, Perera rocks back and cuts it hard in front of square for four
length around off, spin back but slow, Perera gets time to go back and work it towards square leg
length but down the leg side, turn and bounce, pads it away towards fine leg
length ball, just outside off, Maharaj is aiming at that little it of rough, defended solidly on the front foot
uses his feet this time and pushes it back towards the bowler, who fires in the throw back but Perera was quick to undo his steps
length around off and Perera goes for a reverse sweep, doesn't get it exactly right, ends up hitting it low, just past de Kock, gets to fifty with that brace, his second of the match
length outside off, stays back and steers it towards gully
back of length outside off once more, de Silva was much more in control this time, rises on his toes and dabs it down
short of length outside off, was shaping up for a pull but it just keeps rising, left alone in the end
brilliant shot this time, a short of length delivery outside off, bowled at 135 kph, de Silva rises, gets on the top of the bounce and punches it through covers
short of length outside off, goes for the pull, a bit of a top-edge but well short of the deep square leg fielder
back of length around off, stays in his crease and punches it towards extra cover
length on middle and leg, comes forward and defends
length around off, some sharp turn and bounce, de Silva was looking to defend, but ends up playing inside
length but flatter and quicker this time, de Silva goes for the cut and gets beaten
slower this time, fuller on the stumps, defended on the front foot
short of length this time and de Silva was quick to move back and away to punch it towards sweeper cover for a three, Amla puts in the chase
length around off, comes forward and blocks without any fuss
short of length outside off, prods it away towards gully, was in the air, the fielder dives forward but it falls just short
short of length on the pads, tucked away towards deep backward square leg
short of length outside off, goes for the pull but the short midwicket fielder comes in the way
bouncer outside off, goes for the pull but it's way too high, no contact
short of length outside off, chest-high, de Silva jumps in the air and defends
short of length outside off, doesn't bounces much, pulls it into the ground towards the squarer short midwicket
length around off, turns it towards square leg, was looking for a single but realises there is none
short of length outside off, punched towards deep point off the back foot
fuller on the stumps, dead-bats it down the wicket
fuller again, on middle and leg, defended on the leg side
fuller around off, lunges forward and smothers
length around off, use of feet this time by de Silva to chip it away with wrists over midwicket for a couple
short of length in the rib cage, looks to dab it down but misses, the ball brushes the gloves and hits him on the ribs
short again but down the leg side, left alone
short of length around middle and leg, pulled away towards fine leg
short of length around off, doesn't bounces as much, defended from the back foot
a well-directed bouncer, angling in towards the batsman, pulls it down towards the squarer short-midwicket
short of length around off, goes for the pull again, mistimes it towards mid-on, Dean Elgar puts in an awkward dive, ends up tumbling over the ball and concedes a brace
length around off, comes forward and plays it with soft hands, just opening the face of the bat at the last moment for a single to third man
fuller around off and swept nicely towards the square leg boundary, brings up the 50-run stand as well
fuller around off stumps, de Silva gets low and blocks it
a touch quicker this time, length around off, blocked again
length, just outside off, skips down but cannot reach to the pitch of the ball, pads it away in the end
length outside off, a bit of room this time, goes back and punches it away but straight towards the cover fielder
fuller around off, punches it towards mid-off for a quick single
length outside off, stays back and puts his bat in front of it
short of length outside off, punched towards cover, Maharaj from point puts in the slide to keep de Silva on strike
length around off, stays back and pushes it towards point
short of length outside off, looks to punch it through covers, ends up playing it a touch early, mistimed towards extra cover
length ball, pitching outside off and coming back in, defended with a straight bat from the back foot, towards mid-on
fuller around off, uses his feet and pushes it towards extra cover for a quick single
length around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, 83 kph, comes forward and blocks

slower in the air, 74 kph, length around off, looks to defend, the ball takes a thick outside edge and bounces towards first slip, who breaks the stumps with a direct hit but the batsman was always in
length around off, sharp turn and bounce to beat the batsman
flatter around off, comes forward and looks to block, the ball takes the inner half and rolls towards short fine leg
short of length outside off, stays back and dabs it towards extra cover for a quick single
length ball, pitching around leg and angling towards the batsman, who stands in his crease and defends on the off side
a touch fuller this time, similar line though, defended on the front foot with a straight bat
a bouncer this time, but the line is a bit leg-side-ish. Ducked another easily
length around off, defended from the back foot towards cover
banged in short on middle and leg, sails over the batsman who ducked under quite comfortably
Steyn starts full on off stump to start at 139km/h with a hint of wobble on the ball, Dhananjaya pushing his weight forward to defend
fuller this time, and more swing for Steyn, but Dhananjaya is very nicely forward to drive to mid off with a high left elbow
Steyn is already starting to work up some steam, hitting 140km/h, and Dhananjaya defends from the crease
hopping defence from Dhananjaya as Steyn pulls his length back a touch
fuller this time, and attacking the stumps. Dhananjaya digs it out to mid off
Dhananjaya steps into a neat little drive, opening the face of the blade to thread the ball through to the left of the short extra cover, and they hustle back for a second
and he beats the outside edge straight away! Perera didn't need a sighter after the break, leaning into a booming cover drive straight away and hitting only fresh air
again Perera comes forward to drive, but this time without quite as much extravagance and he lays bat to ball to get it to cover
Rabada shoots one right across Perera's bows, the ball starting on leg stump and leaving him outside off as the left hander raises his hands to leave
Rabada tests Perera with a short, quick delivery that's met with a controlled pull out to long leg
just the hint of inward movement for Rabada, but nothing outrageous and Dhananjaya deals with it easily as he defends

edged past a diving Faf du Plessis! The last one came in through the air, this one nipped away off the track and Dhananjaya went fishing for it outside off, edging the ball past Faf at second slip. A little worryingly, the SA captain is down and clutching his shoulder a little - remember, it's been injured before - while at the other end Rabada tumbles through a somersault as the catch goes down. Yes, you read that right
Steyn hits a length outside off and Perera defends in slightly awkward but effective style
a slashing cut now, but it's stopped in the gully, on the bounce
Perera angles his defensive push to a full one, and the gully fielder has more work to do
Steyn shapes one back in to the left hander, who pokes forward to defend
Steyn stays tight on the off stump, and Perera defends once more
Perera spots a full one outside off and crashes a drive past a diving short extra cover, Bavuma sprinting around from the cover sweeper position to cut the shot off
curving away from the bat through the air, and Dhananjaya is a little rooted to the crease as he angles the ball past a diving Elgar at third slip. Controlled, but not entirely so
full, and tapped back to the bowler, who fumbles his stop to allow a quick single
angled in to the right-hander's stumps, and it's tapped to mid on
stroked through mid off! Even with a hint of shape through the air, Dhananjaya is nicely into position to drive and threads his shot straight through the gap to the right of mid off. Top shot
nurdled square, just the one

pulled in the air, but dropping safely! There are two men out on the leg side for the hook, but Perera still took them on. Fortunately for him, the ball lobbed tamely off the splice and so didn't reach them
punched firmly off the back foot, and they're back for the second
straighter from Steyn, and the response from Perera is defensive
short, but it's down the leg side and it's fended further in that direction, for runs
straighter this time, and Perera pushes it back to the bowler
neatly driven to mid off, where Rabada lets it go through his legs to allow a single
a touch of wobble and an attack, middle and off line from Steyn, but Dhananjaya is firmly behind it
Perera is slightly too early into his drive as Rabada pitches one up outside off, but he takes his bottom hand off the bat to check the shot
no checking that one, Perera staying deep in the crease to hammer a cut shot in the air but right through the gap to the left of gully. Fiercely struck!
Perera is a little squared up by one that angles across him, but there's no harm done
pitched right up to the batsman, who nudges it the ball back where it came from
there are cries of  'catch it!' as Perera cuts again, but the ball dips and drops well in front of Markram in the gully
hammered! Dhananjaya has definitely found the middle of his bat now, stepping back and across to scythe a cut through the field as Rabada offered width outside off
turn and bounce straight away for the left-arm spinner, but Perera goes very deep in his crease and works the ball square of the wicket for one
tossed up, and it's met with solid defence
more flight from Maharaj, from around the stumps, and Dhananjaya is well forward again
pushed back defensively
this one rushes on with the arm and squirts off the inner half of the bat towards short fine leg
quicker one to end the over, and it keeps Perera honest
Dhananjaya brings up the 200 with a rifled pull, stepping back and hammering the ball well in front of square
Rabada switches to around the wicket and tests Dhananjaya with another bumper, which is pulled to square leg
Rabada aims another one for the batsman's grille, but again he's back and across to aim a controlled pull out to the man at long leg, and that takes Sri Lanka's target to exactly 100
a direct hit in the field as Perera pushes to Hamza at cover, but he's safely home. Not a bad throw at all, with only one stump to aim at
Dhananjaya walks into a defensive push, sending the ball bouncing to point
another short one, but it's met with another controlled pull down to fine leg for one more

There is a huge, emotive and extended appeal from Maharaj as he hits a sweeping Dhananjaya on the thigh. Umpire Dar says no, but they ask for a review. It's pitched in line, and it hasn't hit the bat ... but it is hitting the stumps. Three reds on the review, and South Africa have the breakthrough!

two in two! Maharaj flights one in from around the stumps and finds grip and spin. The ball kisses the outside edge and flies low to du Plessis at slip. He was left out of the Tests against Pakistan, he only bowled three overs in the first innings, and now Keshav Maharaj is on a hat-trick
beaten outside off! Embuldeniya stays deep in the crease to defend one that shoots past his outside edge. Close!
tossed up, and he's on the drive to cover
sharp spin in to the left hander! Maharaj has brought South Africa right back into this, and it's all happening now
a touch of grip off the surface, but Lasith deals well with it and taps back to the bowler
rising outside off, and it's cut out to deep point for one

sharp stuff from Markram at short leg! Lasith dug a yorker out but over balanced in doing so, Markram plucked it out of the air from under the helmet and very nearly pulled off a repeat of his first innings dismissal of Rajitha
a wristy flick sends the ball rolling out through midwicket, and they're back for the second
short, and gloved, but safe! Rabada dug it in and Lasith ducked and turned his head away, wearing one on the gloves

oh dear, this doesn't look good. Perera flings his hands out at a short ball and is struck a stinging blow on the hand. He goes down, wincing in pain, immediately. He's clutching his wrist, but when the physio comes out it's the hand that he gets to work on with the magic spray. Replays show that he was struck on the right index finger. He seems to be in severe discomfort, but it doesn't look like he'll have to leave the field
pushed down the leg side, de Kock tumbling in the take
turn and bounce out of the rough! With no-one in the deep, Lasith sets himself for a mighty sweep, but can't lay bat on it
turned with the spin, in the air but past Markram at short leg for one
Perera is solidly back and across to defend
reverse sweep this time, Perera getting a good connection and then putting in a sprint to collect two
Perera looks to cut, but chops his shot hard into the turf
nicely done by Perera, clearing his front leg and making sure to place the ball into a gap at cover to keep the strike
almost predictably, his first ball is a bouncer, but it goes harmlessly down the leg side
short again, and it's turned to fine leg with a controlled pull
flicked fine, but straight to Bavuma at short fine leg
straighter this time, but Lasith gets himself right in line to defend

short, fended and gone! He must have known what was coming, but he could do nothing about it. Olivier flings down a bouncer, Lasith takes his eyes off it and fends, and the ball pops up off the glove to be easily held by Markram at short leg
short of length, angled towards the batsman who stays in the crease and defends it on the off side
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but it doesn't bounce as much, a bottom edge goes down, through the keeper's legs
fuller around off, sweeps it towards deep backward square leg
beauty! How did that didn't fetch a wicket. Length ball on the leg side, opening up the batsman and then beating the outside edge with turn, wasn't far away from the off stump either
length on the stumps, looks to push on the leg side, misses. The ball hits the pads and lobs towards silly point
pitched up this time, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, flatter and quicker, defended from the crease
fuller outside off, slower one at 122 kph, mistime the drive to extra cover
short of length on middle and leg, pulls it behind square
short of length around off, rises on his toes, gets on the top of it, takes off the bottom hand and drops it at his feet
short again, outside off, dabbed towards gully

back of length on middle and leg, pushes it towards square leg and sets off, there was no run there and given that it was the fifth ball of the over, they shouldn't have attempted it. A direct hit and that would have been curtains for Kusal Perera
a bouncer on the leg side, swivels to pull it down towards fine leg, South Africa are not interested in bringing the field in yet to keep the No. 10 on strike yet
fuller and down the leg side, sweeps it fine to get a boundary
length around off, swept again, this time not as fine. Only a single
length outside off, spinning away from the batsman as he comes on the front foot to defend, beaten

given lbw. Flatter and quicker, length ball on the off and middle stump, thuds on to the pad before Rajitha could bring his bat down. Rajitha goes for a review. The only doubt is if it was heading down. No bat involved, pitched around off, hits him in front of the leg stump and would have gone on to crash into it. The on-field decision stays as it is. Sri Lanka lose their review as well
fuller on middle stump, a bit of spin away, defended from the crease
fuller this time, on middle and leg, Fernando brings his bat down to keep it away
slower one outside off, drives it towards sweeper cover, doesn't take the single

a sharp bouncer aimed at the batsman, Kusal goes for a pull but the ball hurries on to him, and hits him on the helmet, flush on the badge. He has his helmet off. Fortunately, everything is okay and he is ready to continue
another bouncer but way down the leg side this time, Perera was almost swivelling to pull but realises it's too far away. That's the second bouncer of the over
fuller outside off this time, drives it towards the sweeper cover, takes a single this time
short one but down the leg side, Fernando manages to stay inside the line of the ball
length ball, pitching outside off and going further away, left alone
length around off, Perera skips down and lofts it over wide long-on for a six, he has decided to play his shots, moves to 93
fuller around off, goes down and sweeps it towards deep backward square leg, takes a single surprisingly
fuller on the stumps, Fernando hangs back and blocks
length outside off, comes forward and pushes at it, gets beaten by the turn
length, angled in on the stumps, defended from the back foot
length around off, bowled with a slightly round-arm action, keeps coming in with the angle, bowled at 75 kph only, Fernando manages to defend it, albeit awkwardly
length ball, pitching outside leg and angling in, clears his front leg and looks to smash it away, misses and is struck on the thigh
fuller and wider this time, goes for another hoick, no contact with the bat
short of length down the leg side, looks to move inside and pull it fine, loses his balance and slips, on the bounce to de Kock
a slower short one this time, pulls it in front of square, takes a single, bringing Fernando on strike
and he bowls a bouncer, doesn't bounce much but Fernando manages to duck under
short of length but angling away from the batsman, Fernando lets it go through to the keeper
length around off, stays back and defends it towards short midwicket
length on middle and leg, sweeps it towards fine leg but denies the single
goes for the reverse sweep this time, and it almost carries all the way to the deep cover boundary, moves to 99
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg to bring up his second Test hundred, to go with his fifty in the first innings
length around off, spinning away from the batsman to beat the forward defence
length ball, coming in with the angle, defended from the crease
fuller around off, throws his bat at it, gets a thick outside edge towards third man, doesn't take the single
length around off, looks to push at it, a thick outside edge towards third man, once again denies the run
slower one, short of length around off, dabbed towards sweeper cover
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover, takes a run this time, leaving Fernando to face two once again
short of length on the stumps, backs away and looks to defend, reminded me of Courtney Walsh with that
fuller on the off stump and Fernando puts his bat in front of it to survive
short of length on middle and leg, goes back and pulls it towards deep backward square leg, comes back for the second
fuller outside off, goes down looks to sweep it behind square, misses and gets hit on the pads
length around off, defends it under his eyes
length outside off, plays on the front foot and looks to chop it away, misses as the ball turns big
short of length outside off, punches it towards cover-point for one
length around middle and leg, defended from the crease
short and wide and cuts it towards the left of third man, scampers back for the second
short, on the leg stump and this has been pulled behind square, on to the grass banks, gets to his highest Test score with that six
short of length on the body again, pulled towards fine leg
fuller outside off, steers it towards sweeper cover, doesn't take the single
short of length outside off, cuts it towards deep backward point, a bit of a fumble there but a single is all what he wants
short of length around off, backs away and not sure if he was looking to play or leave, but luckily doesn't get any bat on it
fuller on the off stump, defended from the crease
length around off, spinning back in to the batsman who went for the reverse sweep, misses and gets hit on the body
fuller around off, drives it towards sweeper cover and takes a couple, 49 needed now
length around middle, moves across and helps it towards fine leg, another brace
short of length and spinning on the pads, pulls it towards deep square leg
and he survives. Length around off, a bit of turn, stays back, watches carefully and taps it on the off side
fuller but way outside off, left alone by Perera
short of length outside off, swatted square off the wicket, sweeper cover tidies it up
length around off, looks to hoick it over midwicket, misses and the ball bounces just over the off stump
fuller outside off this time, looks to get his bat on that, misses
length ball on the pads, works it towards square leg for an easy single
fuller on the stumps, almost squaring up the batsman, takes an outside edge that rolls towards slip cordon. But the most important bit is Fernando has managed to keep it out
fuller around off, goes for the sweep and smashes it towards deep midwicket, no run taken
length but down the leg side, goes for the reverse sweep, gets beaten but the ball rolls towards fine leg off the body, two more
length outside off, looks to defend and gets beaten
too full this time, driven towards deep extra cover for a single
fuller around off, stays in his crease and defends it on the off side
length on the stumps, no turn on this one, blocked again
a brilliant yorker, a bit of shape in as well, Perera does well to get his bat on it
length ball around off, looked like an offcutter, defended from the crease
length outside off, another slower one, left alone
another yorker on the off stump, Perera jams his bat at it
short of length on middle, pulls it away towards deep square leg, takes a single
fuller around off, Fernando was looking to defend, gets squared up and beaten as the ball swings away
fuller around off, driven firmly but straight towards extra cover
back of length on the body, Perera goes back and defends
short of length once more, this time more leg-side-ish, turns it on the leg side from the back foot
length around off, steers it behind point, a bit of tag team work there by Bavuma and Steyn near the boundary, Perera sprints back for the second
banged in too short and way down the leg side, Perera was backing away to carve it towards third man but it's too far from him, called a wide
short of length on middle and leg, pulled away behind square, bisecting the gap between fine leg and deep square leg, 34 needed now
a bouncer from Rabada, Perera goes for a pull but cannot connect, and that means Fernando would be on strike against Steyn
short of length around off, looks to defend but gets squared up, somehow hanging there

fuller outside leg stump, gets an outside edge but it lands short of third slip who tumbles around, Perera wants the strike back, Fernando is ball watching, Elgar collects the ball and aims at the non-striker's end, misses and no one is backing up. A direct hit and that would have been out
fuller around off, driven down the ground but long-off is there to cut it off
what a shot! What a hit! Length around middle, Perera has smashed it over deep square leg for a six
fuller around off, pushes it towards extra cover to leave Fernando with one ball to negotiate
length around, just misses the edge, wasn't far away from the off stump either as Fernando gets squared up for the millionth time

length ball on the pads, tucks it towards square leg, Perera wants two, the throw is at the bowler's end, Fernando puts in the dive, a bit too early perhaps, the bowler collects the throw and breaks the stumps but Fernando is in
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but ends up chopping it towards point
length ball, pitching around leg and angling away, gets behind the line and blocks
a top edge and it has gone all the way. Short of length and going away from the batsman, he goes for the pull, gets a top edge and it sails over fine leg
a bouncer, too short and down the leg side, Perera cannot do anything about that
another bouncer, Perera doesn't want to risk it and ducks under, or is he taking a bigger risk by backing Fernando to face Steyn?
short of length, pitching just outside off and moving away, left alone easily
short of length outside off once again, Fernando was almost ducking there, he needn't
fuller on the stump, comes back in a bit, Fernando has his bat in front of this, the ball dribbles past short leg and they sneak in a single
short of length on the stumps and this has been pulled away once again over deep square leg, his fifth six, one more six and the scores will be tied
slower length ball outside off, hits it hard towards sweeper cover, doesn't take the single, will he go for a six?
a yorker outside off, jams his bat it to dig it out towards cover-point, calls his partner for a single and they do it safely
short of length around off, dabs it towards third man, he is not going to swing blindly
length but on the pads, tucked away fine, can he get a boundary here? No, Elgar comes across to cut if off, they take two

and Perera has done it. Short of length outside off, and he has kept his cool, steering it past wide first slip. Where is third man, no where in the picture at least as the ball races towards the boundary. Perera knew as soon as he hit it, raised his arm, a punch in the air, off comes the helmet and in soaks in the moment. A hug from Fernando. Off comes the gloves now, he stretches his arms again
